meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a latch.
meanings.sent1: She was latching the gate to keep the dog safe.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys latching the window shut before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was latching the acorn in its paws like a treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her determination latched onto success like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The sound of latching the suitcase closed echoed in the room.

meanings.definition: To grasp or hold onto something firmly.
meanings.sent1: The baby was latching onto his mother's finger with a strong grip.
meanings.sent2: She latched onto the railing to steady herself on the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The kitten kept latching onto the yarn, thinking it was a playful game.
meanings.sent4: His memory latched onto the happy moments like a lifeline.
meanings.sent5: The climber latching onto the rock face looked like a skilled dancer.

meanings.definition: The act of fastening or securing with a latch.
meanings.sent1: The latching of the door was done carefully to avoid any noise.
meanings.sent2: He heard the latching of the suitcase as the train started moving.
meanings.sent3: The loud latching of the gate startled the birds nearby.
meanings.sent4: The latching of the necklace around her neck felt like a special moment.
meanings.sent5: The smooth latching of the lock indicated a high-quality product.
